column4: Okay, those guides aren't helping me with dual booting. I have Ubuntu installed already, and want to use xp aswell, not the other way around, which is what the guide tells me how to do, it seems.
From my experience you usually have Windows installed first then you install your other OS so that GRUB can find the other partion and configure it during the install.

I beleive that on the GRUB website there is a how to on reconfiguring GRUB if you have done something like what you did. Then again that was some time ago. I would just backup my Ubuntu install and go at it again.
